name: K2-13
scenarioDescription:
The K2-13 Exoplanetary System

K2-13 is a star with 0.8 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.78 times its radius. It is located 1127.72 light years away from the solar system.

K2-13 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

K2-13 b

K2-13 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2015-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 39.91 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, K2-13.

The mass of K2-13 b is 4.46 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-13 b is 1.89 that of Earth. At 4.46 Earth masses, K2-13 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-13, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
